item.title: Pinfold Road SW16 a few yards from, 6th August
item.description:
Pinfold Road SW16 a few yards from Streatham High Road junction at the side of Streatham Library yellow plastic grit bin graffiti tagged. Please forward fixmystreet.com link to your contractor for picture and Google Streetview link: https://www.google.com/maps/@51.4314438,-0.1291367,3a,60y,90t/data=!3m7!1e1!3m5!1sxfqxgJvEzQQdNYIZibqJHg!2e0!6shttps:%2F%2Fstreetviewpixels-pa.googleapis.com%2Fv1%2Fthumbnail%3Fcb_client%3Dmaps_sv.tactile%26w%3D900%26h%3D600%26pitch%3D0%26panoid%3DxfqxgJvEzQQdNYIZibqJHg%26yaw%3D0!7i16384!8i8192?authuser=0&entry=ttu&g_ep=EgoyMDI1MDgwNC4wIKXMDSoASAFQAw%3D%3D

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pinfold Road, Streatham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish not collect in days, 6th August
item.description:
Directly outside the nature garden south Council employees have been emptying the bin leaving the full bags tied at the side of the street but these have not been collected for over a week so have become ripped from animals looking for food and there are rats and mice coming and going

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bantry Street, Camberwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Right hand filter not working in a right turn only lane, 6th August
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Welling Way, Shooters Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Increasing crime and anti social behaviour, 6th August
item.description:
Winchmore Hill has become unsafe due to the council’s non management of the borough and mismanagement in planning, licensing, multi occupancy. Most of green lanes is now populated by male multi occupants in non licensed multi occupancies The men speed up and down the road, populate Artisimo and Coffee 355 en masse and intimidate women walking past. The Parker behind Sainsbury’s is an open drug dealing joint in broad daylight and people come and go retrieving drugs from the same group of men who collect their coffee from Artisimo each time. Then dump their cups across the park. The council have managed to turn Winchmore Hill into a place of non safety for women in just a few short years.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Haslemere Road, Palmers Green, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large 15inch wide and 5 inches Deep Pothole in Middle of Road, 6th August
item.description:
Large Deep Pothole in Middle of Road. It’s been here for ages and is getting worse. Hard to avoid as cars are parked on one side of road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Oakdale Road, Nunhead, London

item.title: Light out - told it was fixed but not, 6th August
item.description:

item.title: Yet more fly tipping, 6th August

item.title: Youths on illegal electric bikes, 6th August
item.description:
It has become an all to apparent problem with youths riding electric bikes along the footpaths at speeds exceeding 40mph. These types of bikes are illegal (250kw/15.5mph is the maximum allowed legal rating). It is only a matter of time before someone is seriously injured or worse. I myself was subject to a near miss and a victim of abusive language while walking along the path.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): East Rochester Way, Blendon, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Untaxed car, 6th August
item.description:
Car been dumped on chilver Street parking bay with no tax ran out 1.5.2025 no mot ran out 3.1.2025 been parked for over 1 month in residents parking bay please remove asap as now as flat tyre.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chilver Street, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 2 temporary signs re traffic lights left on pavement, 6th August
item.description:
Contractor collected yellow fences after road repaired but left two metal stands/signs on pavement weighted by sand bags. Causes pedestrians to walk in road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Derwent Drive, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet
